com.mps.deepviolet.suite

Class CipherSuiteUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mps.deepviolet.suite.CipherSuiteUtil

  • public class CipherSuiteUtil
extends Object
    Utility class to handle cryptographic functions. Significant contributions around ciphersuite handling adapted from code examples by Thomas Pornin. For more information see, The Transport Layer Security (TLS) Protocol Version 1.2, Transport Layer Security (TLS) Parameters, TestSSLServer
    Author:
    Milton Smith

      • getStrength

        public static final String getStrength(String protocol)
        Analysis to determine ciphersuite strength.
        Parameters:
        protocol - Ciphersuite protocol to test.
        Returns:
        String indicating strength, CLEAR(no encryption), WEAK, MEDIUM, STRONG.

        public static final void enableTLSChainTesting(boolean value)
                                        throws Exception
        Enable default testing for TLS certificate trust chains.
        Parameters:
        value - true, chain will be tested. false, chain will not be tested.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown on error

      • getServerCertificateChain

        public static final X509Certificate[] getServerCertificateChain(URL url)
                                                         throws Exception
        Retrieve a certificate chain based upon URL. Note this API will return certificates with unvalidated and possibly bad trust chains.
        Parameters:
        url - Target URL
        Returns:
        X509Certificate Certificate chain
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown on problems.
        See Also:
        java-overriding-function-to-disable-ssl-certificate-check

                                                       throws Exception

        Returns:
        An array of X509Certificates root certificates from the Java trust store
        Throws:

      • isJavaRootCertificateDN

        public static final boolean isJavaRootCertificateDN(String IssuerDN)
                                             throws Exception
        Test to see if a particular IssuerDN is a root in the Java system keystore.
        Parameters:
        IssuerDN - Issuing authority
        Returns:
        true, IssuerDN matches a Java root. false, no matching IssuerDN found.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • checkTrustedCertificate

        public static final boolean checkTrustedCertificate(X509Certificate[] certs,
                                                    URL url)
                                             throws KeyStoreException,
                                                    NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                    UnknownHostException,
                                                    IOException
        Check trust status of each certificate in the chain.
        Parameters:
        certs - Chain of X509Certificates to test.
        url - Server URL to test against.
        Returns:
        True, the certificate chain is trusted. False, the chain is not trusted.
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        UnknownHostException
        IOException

      • isSelfSignedCertificate

        public static final boolean isSelfSignedCertificate(X509Certificate cert)
        Is this test certificate a self-signed certificate.
        Parameters:
        cert - Target certificate to test.
        Returns:
        boolean True, certificate is self-signed. False, certificate is not self-signed.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • walkASN1Sequence

        public static final void walkASN1Sequence(org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1Primitive primitive,
                                          StringBuffer buff)
                                   throws IOException
        Reentrant method to decode ASN1Primiatives. ASN1Primiatives types handled: DEROctetString, DLSequence, DERSequence, DERIA5String, DERBitString, ASN1Boolean, ASN1Integer, DERTaggedObject, ASN1ObjectIdentifier. NOTE: this does not decode all OIDs. For supported OIDs please refer to the code. This is mostly a trial and error process as follows, 1) review logs for unsupported OIDs, 2) include code to support new OIDs, 3) explore more web sites, 4) goto step 1
        Parameters:
        primitive -
        buff -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getExtensionValue

        public static final String getExtensionValue(X509Certificate X509Certificate,
                                             String oid)
                                      throws IOException
        Return the value of the OID associated with the X509Certificate. For more information, How do I decode a DER encoded string in Java?
        Parameters:
        X509Certificate - Certificate to test.
        oid - OID to retrieve.
        Returns:
        String String value for the specified OID parameter.
        Throws:
        IOException
